metadata.Title: CVE-2022-2929 on Ubuntu 16.04 ESM (xenial) - medium.
metadata.Description:
In ISC DHCP 1.0 -> 4.4.3, ISC DHCP 4.1-ESV-R1 -> 4.1-ESV-R16-P1 a system with access to a DHCP server, sending DHCP packets crafted to include fqdn labels longer than 63 bytes, could eventually cause the server to run out of memory.

Update Instructions:

Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2022-2929` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
by updating your system to the following package versions:

isc-dhcp-client - 4.3.3-5ubuntu12.10+esm2
isc-dhcp-client-ddns - 4.3.3-5ubuntu12.10+esm2
isc-dhcp-common - 4.3.3-5ubuntu12.10+esm2
isc-dhcp-relay - 4.3.3-5ubuntu12.10+esm2
isc-dhcp-server - 4.3.3-5ubuntu12.10+esm2
isc-dhcp-server-ldap - 4.3.3-5ubuntu12.10+esm2
Available with Ubuntu Pro (Infra-only): https://ubuntu.com/pro

criterions.comment: isc-dhcp package in esm-infra/xenial was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '4.3.3-5ubuntu12.10+esm2').
